rows.title: Time with your Child Quiz

intro_text.eng: We know that as a caregiver, there are many demands on your time.

question_text.eng: We would love to hear from you: what stands in your way from spending time with your child?

option_4.eng: I don’t know what to do together

option_6.eng: I don’t want to answer this question

feedback_1.eng: Thanks for sharing. Many parents feel this way!

feedback_2.eng: Thanks for sharing. Many parents feel this way!

feedback_3.eng: Thanks for sharing. Many parents feel this way!

feedback_4.eng: Thanks for sharing. Many parents feel this way!

rows.title: Story Time Quiz

question_text.eng: Who is leading the play activity in this story? (response options could be a picture of the dad, or a picture of the child).

feedback_1.eng: Yes, the father is choosing what to play and how to play, instead of letting his son take the lead.

feedback_2.eng: Looking at the story, we can see that the father is actually the one who is choosing what to play and how to play.

rows.question_text: Who is leading the play activity in this story? (response options could be a picture of the dad, or a picture of the child).
rows.feedback_1: Yes, the father is choosing what to play and how to play, instead of letting his son take the lead.
rows.feedback_2: Looking at the story, we can see that the father is actually the one who is choosing what to play and how to play.

rows.question_text: How does Lonwabo feel when his father says that he is doing it wrong?

question_text.eng: How does Lonwabo feel when his father says that he is doing it wrong?

feedback_1.eng: He feels unhappy / not good enough. He might not want to play together again.

feedback_2.eng: Looking at the story, we can see from Lonwabo’s face that he feels unhappy, and then walks away.

rows.feedback_1: He feels unhappy / not good enough. He might not want to play together again.
rows.feedback_2: Looking at the story, we can see from Lonwabo’s face that he feels unhappy, and then walks away.

rows.question_text: What could the father have done differently?

question_text.eng: What could the father have done differently?

option_2.eng: Show interest in what Lonwabo is doing

option_3.eng: Praise or encourage Lonwabo instead of criticizing him

rows.option_2: Show interest in what Lonwabo is doing
rows.option_3: Praise or encourage Lonwabo instead of criticizing him

rows.question_text: What is the father doing that makes this clear?

rows.question_text: How does Lonwabo feel about the way that his father is interacting with him?

rows.title: Practice Time Quiz

intro_text.eng: Let’s practice. Build your own story of how you and your child can spend time together.

question_text.eng: You have 10 minutes to spend some time with your child. What do you do?

option_1.eng: Ask your child if you can spend time together. Let your child decide what they want to do.

option_2.eng: Choose an activity for you and your child. Tell your child they should play with you.

rows.intro_text: Let’s practice. Build your own story of how you and your child can spend time together.
rows.question_text: You have 10 minutes to spend some time with your child. What do you do?
rows.option_1: Ask your child if you can spend time together. Let your child decide what they want to do.
rows.option_2: Choose an activity for you and your child. Tell your child they should play with you.

rows.title: Shared Reading Quiz

question_text.eng: What are some of the ways that children will show us that they are bored, or no longer interested in an activity?

rows.question_text: What are some of the ways that children will show us that they are bored, or no longer interested in an activity?

rows.intro_text: As a parent, making time for yourself can be really challenging. It’s often the last thing that we have time for.

intro_text.eng: As a parent, making time for yourself can be really challenging. It’s often the last thing that we have time for.

question_text.eng: What stands in your way from taking time for yourself?

option_1.eng:
My children and 
family always need 
something from me.

option_3.eng:
It feels selfish to 
take time for myself.

option_5.eng: I don’t want to answer this question

feedback_1.eng: Thanks for sharing, all parents sometimes feel this way

feedback_2.eng: Thanks for sharing, all parents sometimes feel this way

feedback_3.eng: Thanks for sharing, all parents sometimes feel this way
